Subject: LSAT Analytical Reasoning
Background information: 
The LSAT (Law School Admission Test) is a standardized test used for admission to law schools. The Analytical Reasoning section, also known as Logic Games, assesses a candidate's ability to understand and analyze complex relationships, make deductions, and draw logical conclusions.
